intro: Strobilanthes anisophylla, commonly known as the "Ceylon flame flower," is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its striking, showy inflorescences that resemble flames. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and undergrowth. Its leaves are alternate and often have a distinct, lance-shaped form. The flowers are borne in dense clusters and are pollinated primarily by insects, contributing to its ecological significance in its native habitat.
